data.title: How Many DSiWare Games Have You Purchased?
data.text:
Considering this site is one of the very few that explore alot of DSiWare games, I imagine it's influenced the members here to purchase more games. So how many have you purchased, and what games are they? Also, did this site's reviews have influence?

Personally, when buying a points card, I use this as my go to site for reviews, as I have not yet come across a bad DsiWare game that they've given a high score for.

Also, I've currently bought the following

10 Second Run

Army Defender

Asphalt 4: Elite Racing

AlphaBounce

Aura-Aura Climber

Bejewled Twist

Bomberman Blitz

Cave Story

Dark Void Zero

Defense Wars

Escapee GO!

Fieldrunners

Flipnote Studio

Metal Torrent

Photo Dojo

Pinball Pulse

Pop Island

Shantae: Risky's Revenge

Soul of Darkness

Tetris Party Live

Zenonia

All but 5 were purchased without reading reviews from here. (It was before finding this site )

@BedCommando first of all, thanks for the kind words. A little appreciation goes a long way for us reviewers.

And my story is similar to yours: I used to check all of the DSiWare reviews here before making any purchases, and I hadn't been steered wrong. I probably bout between 5 and 10 games based on the reviews here, but now since I've been writing reviews I've had to download a LOT more games than before, but I don't think those really count for this tally

Wow! I'm pretty amazed by some of the numbers in here! I've only got about 6, and one of those doesn't really count. My main problem is that I just don't have that much time for mobile gaming at the moment. I've spent all my gameplaying time over the last 3 years playing nothing but Team Fortress 2.

I joined this site for its DSiWare reviews. They are a big influence on my purchases. Here's what I've got:

A Kappa's Trail

A Topsy Turvy Life: The Turvys Strike Back

AiRace: Tunnel

AlphaBounce

Art Style: AQUIA

Art Style: BASE 10

Art Style: DIGIDRIVE

Art Style: PiCTOBiTS

Art Style: precipice

Art Style: ZENGAGE

Aura-Aura Climber

Chronos Twins

Dark Void Zero

Dracula: Undead Awakening

Escapee Go!

Fieldrunners

Flipnote Studio

Flipper

Globulos Party

Glory Days: Tactical Defense

Glow Artisan

GO Series: 10-Second Run

Looksley's Line Up

Mighty Flip Champs!

Nintendo DSi Browser

Number Battle

Photo Dojo

Pinball Pulse: The Ancients Beckon

Pop Island

Pop Island: Paperfield

Pop+ Solo

Primrose

QuickPick Farmer

Rytmik

Rytmik: Rock Edition

Shantae: Risky's Revenge

Spotto!

Starship Defense

Sudoku

Tetris Party Live

Trajectile

X-Scape

42 in all. I like most of them. And 0 DSi Points remaining, whoo!

The first 4 of these games I've downloaded 2 copies on both my DSi and my DSi XL because I play them so much. And the 3 after that I want to put on my XL, but just haven't done it yet.

Art Academy 1

Art Academy 2

Uno

Suduko

Dr Mario

Animal Crossing Calculator

Animal Crossing Clock

myPostcards

myNotebook

Electroplankton - Luminarrow

DoDoGo

Nemrem

PocketPack: Stategy Games

Sudoku 150

Castle of Magic - deleted, didn't like it

and one of those Brain Training games which I also deleted.

There are about 7 more games that I really want to download, but I've been waiting to see what I'll do about the 3DS. I can't decide if I'll sell my original DSi, and if I should get these games for the XL, or put them on the 3DS. I wish I could transfer them all to the XL.

Yeah, same here with joining for DSiWare reviews. If I didn't have a need to look up reviews, I wouldn't be a part of this site.

yeah I bet you'd all like that

Anyway, I have 31 total. See my backlog for exacts.

38 in total. Here we go.

Art Style: Aquia

Nintendo DSi Browser

Art Style: Pictobits

Mighty Flip Champs!

Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Minis March Again!

Art Style: Boxlife

Art Style: Base 10

Art Style: Zengage

Sudoku Student

FlipNote Studio

Puzzle League Express

Pinball Pulse: The Ancients Beckon

Picturebook Games: Royal Bluff

Art Style: Digidrive

Castle of Magic

Rayman

Pop Island

Trajectile

Touch Solitaire

Dark Void Zero

Escapee GO!

Chronos Twins

Starship Defense

Number Battle

Spotto!

Aura-Aura Climber

Save the Turtles

Photo Dojo

Looksley's Line Up

X-Scape

A Kappa's Trail

Face Pilot

Flametail

Ivy the Kiwi? Mini

Divergent Shift

Link 'n' Launch

I've enjoyed all but Sudoku Student and Rayman was too hard to complete. Currently playing Link 'n' Launch and Puzzle League Express, both of which are highly polished but tough games. I have beaten or completed all the games except the two mentioned above plus a few of the Art Style games.
